column1: id,quote,author
0,The belief in a supernatural source of evil is not necessary men alone are quite capable of every wickedness.,Joseph Conrad
1,Genius begins great works labor alone finishes them.,Joseph Joubert
2,For a writer only one form of patriotism exists: his attitude toward language.,Joseph Brodsky
3,There is nothing that makes its way more directly into the soul than beauty.,Joseph Addison
4,Cheerfulness is the best promoter of health and is as friendly to the mind as to the body.,Joseph Addison
5,The best remedy for a short temper is a long walk.,Joseph Joubert
6,I believe in prayer. It's the best way we have to draw strength from heaven.,Josephine Baker
7,There is nothing more requisite in business than despatch.,Joseph Addison
8,The career stuff is for business people.,Joseph Gordon-Levitt
9,Computers are like Old Testament gods lots of rules and no mercy.,Joseph Campbell
10,In the Soviet army it takes more courage to retreat than advance.,Joseph Stalin
11,Courage is rightly esteemed the first of human qualities - because it is the quality which guarantees all others.,Joseph Chamberlain
12,One death is a tragedy one million is a statistic.,Joseph Stalin
13,Death is the solution to all problems. No man - no problem.,Joseph Stalin
14,The death of one man is a tragedy. The death of millions is a statistic.,Joseph Stalin
15,Perhaps life is just that... a dream and a fear.,Joseph Conrad
16,Man is what he reads.,Joseph Brodsky
17,Education is a weapon whose effects depend on who holds it in his hands and at whom it is aimed.,Joseph Stalin
18,I will not be discouraged by failure I will not be elated by success.,Joseph Barber Lightfoot
19,An Adult faith does not follow the waves of fashion and the latest novelties.,Joseph Ratzinger
20,The abuse of faith has to be resisted precisely.,Joseph Ratzinger
21,Cherish your human connections: your relationships with friends and family.,Joseph Brodsky
22,Love and fear. Everything the father of a family says must inspire one or the other.,Joseph Joubert
23,Not to like ice cream is to show oneself uninterested in food.,Joseph Epstein
24,Love is a friendship set to music.,Joseph Campbell
25,Laughter is God's blessing.,Joseph Prince
26,God is a metaphor for that which transcends all levels of intellectual thought. It's as simple as that.,Joseph Campbell
27,Every country has the government it deserves.,Joseph de Maistre
28,Happiness is itself a kind of gratitude.,Joseph Wood Krutch
29,Happiness does not consist in self-love.,Joseph Butler
30,Life everlasting in a state of happiness is the greatest desire of all men.,Joseph Franklin Rutherford
31,The happiness which is lacking makes one think even the happiness one has unbearable.,Joseph Roux
32,Happiness is the real sense of fulfillment that comes from hard work.,Joseph Barbara
33,History shows that there are no invincible armies.,Joseph Stalin
34,The real history of consciousness starts with one's first lie.,Joseph Brodsky
35,Our poverty will be brought home to us to its full extent only after the war.,Joseph A. Schumpeter
36,Going home must be like going to render an account.,Joseph Conrad
37,Imagination is the eye of the soul.,Joseph Joubert
38,He who has imagination without learning has wings but no feet.,Joseph Joubert
39,One who has imagination without learning has wings without feet.,Joseph Joubert
40,Jehovah God is truly rich far beyond the imagination of humankind.,Joseph Franklin Rutherford
41,It is not ignorance but knowledge which is the mother of wonder.,Joseph Wood Krutch
42,Plant thy foot firmly in the prints which His foot has made before thee.,Joseph Barber Lightfoot
43,Play is the only way the highest intelligence of humankind can unfold.,Joseph Chilton Pearce
44,More men die of jealousy than of cancer.,Joseph P. Kennedy
45,I was studying for the SAT's and learning lines.,Joseph Gordon-Levitt
46,I've had a tough time learning how to act like a congressman. Today I accidentally spent some of my own money.,Joseph P. Kennedy
47,All ambitions are lawful except those which climb upward on the miseries or credulities of mankind.,Joseph Conrad
48,No oppression is so heavy or lasting as that which is inflicted by the perversion and exorbitance of legal authority.,Joseph Addison
49,The privilege of a lifetime is being who you are.,Joseph Campbell
50,Opportunities to find deeper powers within ourselves come when life seems most challenging.,Joseph Campbell
51,Your life is the fruit of your own doing. You have no one to blame but yourself.,Joseph Campbell
52,A hero is someone who has given his or her life to something bigger than oneself.,Joseph Campbell
53,A part of kindness consists in loving people more than they deserve.,Joseph Joubert
54,Only choose in marriage a man whom you would choose as a friend if he were a woman.,Joseph Joubert
55,My marriage had been impulsive. That marriage should have been short-lived instead of the 23 years it spanned.,Joseph Barbera
56,It's all about the money.,Joseph Jackson
57,Work is a prayer. And I start off every morning dedicating it to our Creator.,Joseph Murray
58,Movies are different from real life.,Joseph Gordon-Levitt
59,Nothing is capable of being well set to music that is not nonsense.,Joseph Addison
60,There is not so variable a thing in nature as a lady's head-dress.,Joseph Addison
61,Mutability of temper and inconsistency with ourselves is the greatest weakness of human nature.,Joseph Addison
62,I take it that what all men are really after is some form or perhaps only some formula of peace.,Joseph Conrad
63,Peace on earth would mean the end of civilization as we know it.,Joseph Heller
64,My third appeal is to my fellow citizens in all countries: Help us to establish lasting peace in the world.,Joseph Rotblat
65,Cats seem to go on the principle that it never does any harm to ask for what you want.,Joseph Wood Krutch
66,You will find poetry nowhere unless you bring some of it with you.,Joseph Joubert
67,You will not find poetry anywhere unless you bring some of it with you.,Joseph Joubert
68,Poetry is the exquisite expression of exquisite expressions.,Joseph Roux
69,Poetry is truth in its Sunday clothes.,Joseph Roux
70,Politics is the conspiracy of the unproductive but organized against the productive but unorganized.,Joseph Sobran
71,The only real power comes out of a long rifle.,Joseph Stalin
72,Nothing is more gratifying to the mind of man than power or dominion.,Joseph Addison
73,Knowing that you are completely forgiven destroys the power of sin in your life.,Joseph Prince
74,Superstition is the only religion of which base souls are capable of.,Joseph Joubert
75,A man's real life is that accorded to him in the thoughts of other men by reason of respect or natural love.,Joseph Conrad
76,From my earliest days I had a passion for science.,Joseph Rotblat
77,I saw science as being in harmony with humanity.,Joseph Rotblat
78,What is the damnation of hell? To go with that society who have not obeyed His commands.,Joseph Smith
79,It is a maudlin and indecent verity that comes out through the strength of wine.,Joseph Conrad
80,Daoist thought is the root of science and technology in China.,Joseph Needham
81,Perfection is the child of time.,Joseph Hall
82,I used my aviation contacts to open a travel agency. I used to book Caribbean flights.,Joseph Force Crater
83,I would say readers can trust my work more than anyone else's.,Joseph J. Ellis
84,A man must be both stupid and uncharitable who believes there is no virtue or truth but on his own side.,Joseph Addison
85,Those who never retract their opinions love themselves more than they love the truth.,Joseph Joubert
86,Justice is the truth in action.,Joseph Joubert
87,A caricature is putting the face of a joke on the body of a truth.,Joseph Conrad
88,What a man knows is everywhere at war with what he wants.,Joseph Wood Krutch
89,A woman seldom asks advice before she has bought her wedding clothes.,Joseph Addison
90,Our experience is composed rather of illusions that of wisdom acquired.,Joseph Roux
91,As to honor - you know - it's a very fine mediaeval inheritance which women never got hold of. It wasn't theirs.,Joseph Conrad
